alert.note: Alert for Garvin (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:23AM CDT until July 09 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR EASTERN GARVIN...SOUTHWESTERN SEMINOLE...SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND...NORTHWESTERN PONTOTOC...NORTHEASTERN MURRAY... SOUTHWESTERN POTTAWATOMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 523 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Etowah to 3 miles east of Rosedale to 3 miles north of Wynnewood to 4 miles northwest of Davis, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Pauls Valley, Sulphur, Davis, Wynnewood, Stratford, Konawa, Maud, Roff, Wayne, Paoli, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Katie, Byars, St. Louis, Etowah, Rosedale, and Macomb. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
